alert.note: Alert for Chattooga; Floyd; Gilmer; Gordon; Murray; Walker; Whitfield (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 12 at 1:01PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of west central Gilmer, southern Murray, Floyd, southeastern Whitfield, southeastern Walker, Gordon and central Chattooga Counties through 130 PM EST... At 100 PM EST, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from near Dawnville to Sugar Valley to near Rome, and moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Rome, Dalton, Calhoun, Chatsworth, Adairsville, Resaca, Plainville, Shannon, Pinson, Redbud, Lake Marvin, Coosa, Oakman, Fort Mountain State Park, Holland, Carters, Sonoraville, Tails Creek, Ramhurst and Oostanaula. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 PM EST for north central and northwestern Georgia.

area.areaDesc: Chattooga; Floyd; Gilmer; Gordon; Murray; Walker; Whitfield
